column4: I just installed ubuntu 8.04 and restarted to boot for the first time.  Where the grub boot menu should be, there is a flashing cursor.  How can I fix?
did u try to open anything else?
also can u reboot from the terminal
open?  machine will not boot
oh. idk then, did u check the forums?
do u have initscripts installed?
in synaptic
I cannot get there.  My machine will not boot
does it get past grub?
no. that's where the flashing cursor appears... where grub should be
ah then its a grub problem. do u have the live cd?
yes
so just use it to reinstall grub
didn't work
same behavior with opensuse 11.0, ubuntu 8.04 and ubuntu 7.10
I have grub installed both in the boot partition header and in the drive's mbr
did u edit the menu.lst?
no. it looked fine to me
is there a partition flagged as boot
that's what I mean.  let me check that
is it flagged?
